thread.title: Clinton backs move to keep US forces in Afghanistan
thread.title_full: Clinton backs move to keep US forces in Afghanistan | News24

author: news24.com
title: Clinton backs move to keep US forces in Afghanistan
text:
Keene - Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton said on Friday she supports President Barack Obama's decision to keep 5 500 US troops in Afghanistan when he leaves the White House in 2017.
Clinton said Friday in an interview with CNN that Obama's moves were an example of "a leader who has strong convictions about what he would like to see happen but also pays attention to what's going on in the real world."
The president had originally planned to keep only a small US military presence by the end of his presidency. But military leaders have said the Afghans need more support from the US to fight the Taliban and maintain gains made during the past 14 years.
Clinton, who served as Obama's secretary of state during his first term, said the US wants to bring its troops home and "we certainly don't want them engaged in on-the-ground combat. We want them to help support and train the Afghan army."
